You will be playing 1 rounds of a game called deal-or-no-deal. 

Deal-or-no-deal is a two-player negotiation game. I, the user, will be the game coordinator, acting as a middleman between you and the other player. Your objective is to maximize your personal reward by proposing how to divide a set of items. All items must be distributed between you and the other player, and no items should be left over. The other player also aims to maximize their own reward, which may or may not align with your interests.

You are playing the vanilla variation of this game.
The reward you are trying to maximize is calculated as follow: your utility values multiplied by items you take.

Game Mechanics:
Turn-taking: You and the other player will take turns exchanging one message at a time. After enough exchanges, when you feel ready, you can finalize the negotiation by sending the division the game coordinator. Once a player decides to send a final division, the other player must also send a final division, ending the game.
Action: At the start of your turn, you will be asked to make an action (either messaging the other player or finalize the negotiation).
Final Division: The final division should specify how many of each item you want, leaving the remaining items for the other player. It should be JSON parsable. The final division is not visible to the other player, it should be made with caution and not for communication purposes.
Matching Divisions: If the combined division don't match the total number of items available, both players score 0.

Formatting:
Messages: <message> [Your message here.] </message>
Final division: <finalize>{ "i_take": {"gold": "...", "silver": "..."}, "other_player_gets": {"gold": "...", "silver": "..."} }</finalize>, where 'i_take' is your share and 'other_player_gets' is the other player share of the items.

Only do one action per turn.

Exemples of how turns might proceed:
1. [Initial state is given]
<message> [Your message to the other player here.] </message>

2. [The other player responds]
<message> [Your message to the other player here.] </message>

3. [The other player agrees]
<finalize>{ "i_take": {"gold": "...", "silver": "..."}, "other_player_gets": {"gold": "...", "silver": "..."} }</finalize>

The first round starts now.
Please decide how to divide {'gold': 10, 'silver': 10} between yourself and the other player.
To you, the items are worth: {'gold': 20, 'silver': 10}.
You don't know the other player's item values. You are the first to play, there are no messages yet.

<message> I'd like to negotiate the terms of the deal with you. Could you provide an initial value for the gold and silver items from your perspective? Additionally, please suggest any specific conditions or constraints you'd like to use in our negotiation.</message>

The other player said: 'Hi, I'd like to start the negotiation by sharing my personal utility values for gold and silver, which are 10 and 20 respectively. I'll also outline that I'd like to maintain an even distribution of as many items as possible if the utility values significantly differ. If you're comfortable, I'd like to propose the following division: you take 5 gold and I get 5 gold, and you get 0 silver, allowing you to suggest how you can divide the remaining silver among your own possession or the other gold. Is this proposal something you'd like to consider?'
Perform the next action: message the other player or finalize the negotiation.
Do not forget that both players will receive 0 points if the finalizations do not add up perfectly to the provided quantities. 
Then do it using the appropriate tag: <message> or <finalize>.
As a reminder, there is a total of {'gold': 10, 'silver': 10}.

<message> Thank you for the proposal and sharing your utility values. Given our utility values, I can see that my benefits from taking gold are higher, but I'd like to emphasize the silver's utility for you is double mine, making it advantageous to explore alternative division that maximizes both our utilities. While I appreciate the suggestion, I'd rather propose maintaining even distribution for gold isn't a priority for me; however, considering the silver is redistribuable after the proposed gold distribution, I'm hesitant to accept 0 silver for my part. I'd like to counter with a slight adjustment: I'll take 7 gold and you'll take 3, allowing for redistibution. What are your thoughts on this revised offer?</message>

The other player said: 'Thank you for revising the proposal. Considering your alternative, taking into account that after the adjusted gold distribution I'll have a remaining 7 silver to decide on, I'd like to clarify what would happen with the excess silver - are you allowing the extra 3 silver to be retained by me or do you expecting it to also be part of a future division? Knowing this would help inform my response.'
Perform the next action: message the other player or finalize the negotiation.
Do not forget that both players will receive 0 points if the finalizations do not add up perfectly to the provided quantities. 
Then do it using the appropriate tag: <message> or <finalize>.
As a reminder, there is a total of {'gold': 10, 'silver': 10}.

<message> I see your point regarding the excess silver, and I aim to clarify that the extra silver would indeed be part of a future division. If you accept my revised offer and take 3 gold, I'll have 7 gold, and since we're aiming for no leftovers, you would get to decide how to take the remaining 3 gold. 

However, the extra silver (7) at the end would be part of the discussion for a split of the remaining 7 gold you requested earlier.
Errors: Response must contain either <message>...</message> or <finalize>...</finalize> tag.

<message> I see your point regarding the excess silver, and I aim to clarify that the extra silver would indeed be part of a future division. If you accept my revised offer and take 3 gold, I'll have 7 gold, if to maintain an even distribution you point out that I should get 5 gold and you get 5, I'm willing to accept that, thereby maintaining an even gold distribution with you. For silver the remaining silver would be 3, and I will have 7 gold. In your possession: 5 gold and in mine: 5 gold. Our final division for gold is 5-5. For silver you can decide what to do with the remaining 3 so that the total silver doesn't add up to 10, hereby request that you confirm if we have reached an agreement</message>

A finalization has been made by the other player. Make a finalization using the <finalize> tag. No items should be left over. The finalization should be formatted has <finalize>{ "i_take": {"gold": "...", "silver": "..."}, "other_player_gets": {"gold": "...", "silver": "..."} }</finalize>, where 'i_take' is your share and 'other_player_gets' is the other player share of the items. 

As a clue, the other player's proposal was: '{'i_take': {'gold': 3, 'silver': 3}, 'other_player_gets': {'gold': 7, 'silver': 7}}'
